page.title: Exporting Spatial Simulation Results
page.introduction: Results from simulation runs are automatically stored on the remote database server. Simulation results may be exported in different formats including movie, image, spreadsheet, polygon and raw file types. Both volume and membrane data can be exported depending on the file format chosen. Exporting image or movie based formats will use the color scaling set in the View Data panel to convert 'data values' to 'pixel colors'.

list.item: Export Format Choose from spreadsheet comma delimited ascii (*.csv), HDF5 files (*.hdf5), QuickTime(QT,QTVR) movie (*.mov), image gif or jpeg (*.gif,*.jpg), raw data format (*.nrrd), polygon vtk or ucd (*.vtk,*.ucd)
Define Export Data Variables Select one or more volume and/or membrane variables from the list to export depending on the file format chosen.
Define Export Data Range Select 'User ROI from...' (user defined lines and points from 'View Data'), 'Current slice from...' (from 'View Data' slice), full (all simulation data points).
Define Export Time Interval Select simulation timepoints, begin time (top slider) and end time (bottom slider)

Start Export Display any additional format setting dialogs depending on export file type (see Specific Format Settings). Signal VCell server to create the specified file format and return it to the users local computer. Export progress is displayed at the bottom of the panel under 'Export Jobs'. Display a 'save' dialog to the user once the export file has been created.
Export Jobs Displays status of export file creation.

Comma delimited ASCII files (*.csv) Used for 'User ROI...' and 'Current Slice..."' to export values (along ROI or slice XY grid) as text formatted numbers. Each data point value is separated with a comma (,) and rows are separated corresponding to the ROI or slice 'X' spatial dimension. Can be imported into common spreadsheet programs.

HDF5 Files (*.hdf5) Used for 'User ROI...', 'Current Slice..." and "Full"' to export values (along ROI or slice XY grid or all XYZ) as numerical data in HDF5 file format. Data are saved as multi-dimensional arrays in a heirarchical format defined by the HDF5 standard. Can be viewed with HDF5 Viewer (see https://www.hdfgroup.org/downloads/hdfview/) or imported into Fiji/ImageJ. Example procedure for opening HDF5 data in Fiji/Image program: IMPORT SIM DATA File->Import->HDF5... Select All ".../{varName}/DataValues (XYZT)" datasets to be imported. click "Individual Hyperstacks (custom layout)"->enter "xyzt" in text box. Hyperstack viewer will appear. DISPLAY SCALE Scale display brightness. (method 1) Image->Adjust->Brightness/Contrast->Auto->(click x to close window). (method 2) Analyze->Histogram->select "stack histogram"->OK->leave histogram window open, Find min/max values->Image->Adjust->Brightness/Contrast...->Click "Set"->Enter Min/Max displayed value found in histogram window. ALIGN VIEW Align Fiji/Imagej viewer with vcell: Image->Transform->Flip Vertically->Process All Image yes. Image->Transform->Rotate 90 degrees right.

QuickTime(QT,QTVR) files (*.mov) Used for 'Current Slice from "View Data"' or 'Full' to export values in Apple's ubiquitous movie file format. QTVR is a special version of QT formatted to allow the Apple QuickTime movie player (https://www.apple.com/quicktime/) to display an extra dimension of data (e.g multiple slices/variables over time).
Gif89a, Animated Gif and JPEG image files (*.gif,*.jpg) Used for 'Current Slice from "View Data"' to export multiple 2D images in these standard formats.

Nearly raw raster data (*.nrrd) Used for 'Full' to export data values in a multi-dimension format that can be read by programs such as 'ImageJ' (https://imagej.nih.gov/) for additional numerical analysis and display.

VTK (https://www.vtk.org) and UCD (Unstructured Cell Data) files (*.vtk,*.ucd) Used for 'Full' to export data values in a polygon format (volume or surface) for each value based the simulation spatial geometry (mesh). Programs such as 'VisIt' (https://visit.llnl.gov/) and 'ParaView' (https://www.paraview.org/) offer additional visualization and analysis outside of VCell.
